title.narrative: Financial Literacy and You (FLY) - Team Member Engagement

description.narrative:
1) Outside the Factory (OTF) productivity validation a. Socialization of project with community representatives, local government agencies, factory workers and factory owners. b. Stakeholder mapping and analysis c. Support researchers and consultants to assess the likelihood that community activities with factory workers and families will increase productivity. d. Work with communities, local government agencies and Nike, to prioritize specific types of interventions. e. In order to strengthen relationship with communities, investigate the opportunities to pilot small scale interventions in communities at an early stage in project.
2) Facilitating and managing partnerships a. Identify potential partners for main phase activities in target communities. b. Build/strengthen relationships with partners (likely to include local government agencies, local universities/research institutions, financial institutions, community). c. Convene and facilitate community activities.
3) Leveraging other donors a. Utilizing Mercy Corps' network in Indonesia and globally, build relationships with potential donors (including government of Indonesia) to leverage additional funding for activities where possible.
4) Groundwork for implementation a. Build relationships with community, local government agencies and factory owners with the aim of rapid start-up of full project activities in early 2013. b. Recruit and prepare team to participate in planning phase and start main phase implementation of interventions in early 2013.
5) Program design a. In coordination with Nike and researcher/consultant team, design full program and prepare proposal.
6) Monitoring and documentation/reporting a. Monitor activities during first six months and prepare and deliver a detailed report on findings including recommendations for next phase. b. Prepare and deliver a detailed metrics and monitoring and evaluation plan for full program. c. Collect, collate and deliver data from project activities. d. Disseminate report to key stakeholders. e. Organize and facilitate feedback sessions with Nike on findings (positive and negative).
The overall goal of the FLY program is to enhance TMs’ capacity to make key household spending, savings and lending decisions, taking full advantage of existing financial products, in order to improve TM well-being.
The specific objectives that will contribute to the achievement of the program goal are as follows: 1. Develop a sustainable network of TM Change Agents to provide continued support for long term financial guidance and coaching to ensure sustainable impact. 2. Increase TMs’ knowledge and skills around basic financial concepts, including budgeting, savings and debt, as well as on the new compensation payslip and existing health policy. 3. Increase TM access to existing financial products through education on such products and related financial institutions.

This is an initial planning phase where Mercy Corps will work closely with Nike to develop and finalize the strategy for community development and worker empowerment for Indonesian factory workers at two contract factories that produce Nike branded products in Tangerang and Karawang.
The FLY program seeks to engage TMs in the process of creating a financial literacy program that specifically identifies and addresses the unique financial behaviors of TMs. Mercy Corps will accomplish this goal through using the positive deviance methodology whereby Mercy Corps will identify TMs with positive financial behaviors, learn how they developed such behaviors, and design a program that scales these behaviors across the TM population.
